The sprawling metropolis of Tokyo is a city you can't miss viewing from above. As one of the highest viewing spots in the city, you're guaranteed a great view atop the 634m Tokyo Skytree. Claiming the title of the world's tallest free standing tower, on clear days you can see up to 100km away, beyond even Mount Fuji, whilst at night you can observe the glittering city lights. Shoot up to one of two observation decks and brave the dizzying glass floor at the Tembo Deck (350m) or the vertiginous glass corridor of the Tembo Galleria (450m) - it's certainly not for acrophobics! In contrast the amphibious Sky Duck seamlessly takes you from land to sea aboard one vehicle. Begin by driving along the Tokyo city streets before the effortless transition into a Tokyo sightseeing cruise on the water.

When you understand the concept, it's easy to see why it's so popular. 100 different types of sakes from all over Japan, an all-you-can-drink philosophy, BYO food (there's a nearby supermarket), and an almost open-ended duration. Get a deep cultural insight into Japan's national sport with a guided visit to watch real sumo wrestlers complete their morning training Get a close up look at the sumo wrestlers' morning fight practice Observe the physical practice and cultural traditions of sumo for around 2 hours Your informative tour guide will ensure that you gain an in depth knowledge of everything to do with this historic Japanese sport Get a close up look at the sumo wrestlers' morning fight practice Get a close up look at the sumo wrestlers' morning fight practice Observe the physical practice and cultural traditions of sumo for around 2 hours Observe the physical practice and cultural traditions of sumo for around 2 hours Your informative tour guide will ensure that you gain an in depth knowledge of everything to do with this historic Japanese sport Your informative tour guide will ensure that you gain an in depth knowledge of everything to do with this historic Japanese sport What We Love:   What We Love: It's a fair statement to say that sumo wrestling must be one of the world's most unique national sports. Sumo originated in Japan as early as the 1600s and Japan remains the only country where this heavyweight sport is practiced professionally. Fighters live in communal 'stables' where every aspect of their daily lives is dictated by strict tradition. These traditions, etiquette and customs are not taken lightly. Many sumo stables are not open to foreign visitors and for those that are, even spectactors are expected to adhere to certain rules. Luckily this tour includes a local guide who will pick you up from your hotel and thoroughly prep you on everything you need to know before watching the sumos in their morning training rituals. It's a unique Japanese experience and far more than just a fight, as you'll soon find out...

strIntroduction: Tour and explore Tokyo Asakusa in style. Let your rickshaw guide take you past the famous Kaminarimon with its huge paper lanterns and along the old town alleys of Asakusa Get a unique perspective of Tokyo on a rickshaw tour of Asakusa Pass the iconic Kaminarimon Gate, the Sensoji Temple and Tokyo Skytree among other famous sights in Asakusa Explore the quirky neighborhoods where you can still appreciate the history and atmosphere of what was once the most prosperous town in Tokyo Join us for an experience of Japanese culture instead of completing your visit of Asakusa with only shopping, the most popular pastime in the area Get a unique perspective of Tokyo on a rickshaw tour of Asakusa Pass the iconic Kaminarimon Gate, the Sensoji Temple and Tokyo Skytree among other famous sights in Asakusa Explore the quirky neighborhoods where you can still appreciate the history and atmosphere of what was once the most prosperous town in Tokyo Join us for an experience of Japanese culture instead of completing your visit of Asakusa with only shopping, the most popular pastime in the area What We Love:   What We Love: Asakusa in downtown Tokyo is alive with a characteristic traditional ambience that removes you from the bustle of 21st century Tokyo. Swing by the famous Kaminari Gate, the entrance to the grand Sensoji Temple and have your rickshaw tour guide take pictures as you pose under the gate's giant red lantern before your departure. Explore the Nakamise Shopping Street or adjoining alleyways offering a wide variety of mouth-watering lunch options. Travel between Asakusa's popular tourist destinations hassle-free, enjoy the city from a different height on a rickshaw perfect for two.

Stroll Asakusa dressed in an authentic Japanese kimono with packages for individuals, friends, couples and students Experience what it's like to wear an authentic kimono Choose your preferred kimono design and let the experts dress you and style with hair with beautiful ornaments Stroll the historic streets of Asakusa on your own time (return kimonos before 4:30pm) Friends and couples can enjoy great value packages for groups For something unique, opt for the Hakama with Casual Furisode Plan (the traditional wear of female students in the Meiji period and now the popular outfit choice for girls at graduation Experience what it's like to wear an authentic kimono Experience what it's like to wear an authentic kimono Choose your preferred kimono design and let the experts dress you and style with hair with beautiful ornaments Choose your preferred kimono design and let the experts dress you and style with hair with beautiful ornaments Stroll the historic streets of Asakusa on your own time (return kimonos before 4:30pm) Stroll the historic streets of Asakusa on your own time (return kimonos before 4:30pm) Friends and couples can enjoy great value packages for groups Friends and couples can enjoy great value packages for groups For something unique, opt for the Hakama with Casual Furisode Plan (the traditional wear of female students in the Meiji period and now the popular outfit choice for girls at graduation For something unique, opt for the Hakama with Casual Furisode Plan (the traditional wear of female students in the Meiji period and now the popular outfit choice for girls at graduation What We Love:   What We Love: On arrival at one of the three kimono rental stores in Asakusa, you'll be presented with a wide array of colorful kimonos to choose from. Yukata (summer kimonos) are available for the hotter months whilst the 'hakama with casual furisode' is the popular option for graduating female students, a tradition dating back to the Meiji Period. Make your selection before being whisked into the styling area where skilled experts will diligently dress you in your kimono (complete with robe, obi, bag, socks, shoes and shawl) and hair styling with decorative ornaments. After this you'll have free time to stroll through Asakusa, an area which still retains a very traditional Tokyo atmosphere - the perfect backdrop for your photos! The Tokyo Kimono Experience offers a choice of packages designed for individuals, couples, friends and graduating students, and services in English, Japanese or Chinese.

Even getting dressed in a delicate art in the life of a geisha. Discover how geiko women and maiko girls adorn themselves with a tour of Tokyo's Asakusa district – dressed in a kimono! You'll have your pick of a selection of around 30 delicate kimonos, and assistants to show you the ropes of kimono wearing. Once you're properly attired, a guide will take you on a stroll through the cosmopolitan streets of Asakusa, offering some information and cultural tidbits along the way.

Next, head back to the kitchen where sushi lovers' dreams are fulfilled with an exclusive sushi-making lesson guided by a professional Japanese chef. Experience the fish market world of Tokyo and enjoy your lunch filled with self-made sushi—it's the ultimate fishy entertainment!

Japanese tea culture is an art, a tradition, a symbol of culture, a ceremony. It is believed that tea ceremonies maintain a peaceful mind and wash away stress or fatigue. In this unique Japanese tea ceremony experience in Tokyo, your hosts dressed in traditional kimonos give a native insight into the importance of tea ceremonies in Japan. Watch the whole meticulous process first hand then enjoy your delicious tea accompanied by some delectable sweet treats.

Drink like the locals do on a bar hopping tour of Tokyo led by an entertaining and experienced bar hop guide! Dive in and out of watering holes popular with the locals, kick back with a Japanese brew and munch on favorite foods at 'Izakaya' restaurant/bars. You'll get a first hand insight into Tokyo night life and Japanese drinking culture from local establishments (no tourists here!) - Kanpai!

And for all you fashionistas, relish in a guided tour of Roppongi, Tokyo's famous 300-year-old boutique fashion district. The energetic tour guides and vibrant atmosphere create the ideal experience for anyone wanting a taste of Tokyo's nightlife.

Now for something a little different from your usual list of things to do in Japan: an army-style combat battle against your friends in an indoor airplay arena! Engage in a shooting battle in a spacious indoor all-weather playing field Equip yourself with the most sophisticated airsoft gear Beginners are also welcome to join the experience Challenge all your friends with maximum of 15 people per group Engage in a shooting battle in a spacious indoor all-weather playing field Equip yourself with the most sophisticated airsoft gear Beginners are also welcome to join the experience Challenge all your friends with maximum of 15 people per group What We Love:   What We Love: Gear up for battle: put on your camouflage, load your BB gun and get ready to take down your enemies (...or friends and travel companions)! Using the traditional style and guided by a skilled instructor, make a beautiful Japanese-style towel, hand dyed with an original Japanese technique called 'Chusen'. Walk through the full manufacturing process of a craftsman, such as dyeing part of a design using various colors, washing techniques to clean off the color, and more. Depending on your schedule and budget, choose between the basic or full course.

strIntroduction: A musical show filled with Japanese traditional and contemporary music accompanied by multiple dance techniques that promises to impress! Experience the thrill of battle in scenes of Samurais and Ninjas with amazing animation projection mapping Witness the beauty of Nihon Buyo (a Japanese traditional dance) synchronized with modern street dance Explore the vivid sounds of Japanese traditional musical instruments paired with rock music Use the show's app to read the English/Chinese subtitles in real time or to take pictures with filters made especially for this show Experience the thrill of battle in scenes of Samurais and Ninjas with amazing animation projection mapping Witness the beauty of Nihon Buyo (a Japanese traditional dance) synchronized with modern street dance Explore the vivid sounds of Japanese traditional musical instruments paired with rock music Use the show's app to read the English/Chinese subtitles in real time or to take pictures with filters made especially for this show What We Love:   What We Love: Don't miss your chance to see Sakura – Japan In A Box at the Meijiza Theater in Japan, the theater with the longest history in Tokyo. Follow the story of Sakura, a high-school girl in search of finding herself. She meets a white fox who takes her on a journey across a mysterious land. Travel with them throughout the four seasons as Sakura discovers what is truly important in life. The show combines Japanese traditional arts such as musical instruments and dance with contemporary anime and modern pop culture dancing. Don't speak Japanese? No problem! The show is filled with expressive dancing and acting that will make it easy to follow Sakura's journey. What's more, you can download the show's app and read the subtitles (English or Chinese) in real time as the show is being performed!
strTitle: Sakura - Japan In The Box Show

strIntroduction: Appreciate the beauty of ancient and modern Japan on a Tokyo walking tour to Meiji Shrine, Imperial Palace, and the Nihonbashi business district Experience the quietly stunning beauty of Meiji Shrine built in the 1920s Discover the mysterious past of the Japanese imperial family and glimpse the splendid architectural design of the palace Stroll Nihonbashi, visit the famous bridge and soak up the prosperous atmosphere Allow your English speaking guide to better explain Tokyo's history as you tour the area Experience the quietly stunning beauty of Meiji Shrine built in the 1920s Experience the quietly stunning beauty of Meiji Shrine built in the 1920s Discover the mysterious past of the Japanese imperial family and glimpse the splendid architectural design of the palace Discover the mysterious past of the Japanese imperial family and glimpse the splendid architectural design of the palace Stroll Nihonbashi, visit the famous bridge and soak up the prosperous atmosphere Stroll Nihonbashi, visit the famous bridge and soak up the prosperous atmosphere Allow your English speaking guide to better explain Tokyo's history as you tour the area Allow your English speaking guide to better explain Tokyo's history as you tour the area What We Love:   What We Love: Tokyo's most famous Shinto shrine, Meiji Shrine, is a welcome retreat from the frenzy of Tokyo. Soak up the serence atmosphere, write wishes on paper tied to the prayer wall, or watch a wedding procession glide past. Next stop is the city's impressive Imperial Palace. Once the world's largest fortress (though little of it remains), the palace is now home to the Emperor and Imperial Family. Whilst most of the building is off limits, the grounds and East Garden are a beautiful place to stroll. Afterwards, venture into the 'center of Japan' at Tokyo's business district, Nihonbashi. A hub of shopping and dining, make sure to also walk over the area's namesake, Nihonbashi Bridge.

Watch the snow monkeys of Japan huddle together and bathe by the Nagano hot springs to keep themselves warm during the winter on a private day trip from Tokyo Experience the comfort, convenience, and fast-pace of the high speed rail to Nagono Explore the Zenkoji Temple which stores the first Buddhist statue ever to be brought into Japan Come close to the snow monkeys in their natural habitat at Jigokudani Monkey Park Watch as the cute monkeys descend from the forest and sit in the warm waters of the hot springs Meet your English speaking guide at the station for a personal and informative day tour Experience the comfort, convenience, and fast-pace of the high speed rail to Nagono Explore the Zenkoji Temple which stores the first Buddhist statue ever to be brought into Japan Come close to the snow monkeys in their natural habitat at Jigokudani Monkey Park Watch as the cute monkeys descend from the forest and sit in the warm waters of the hot springs Meet your English speaking guide at the station for a personal and informative day tour What We Love:   What We Love: Meet the Japanese macaques - more commonly known as snow monkeys - native to Japan in this up close and personal tour! When you arrive at the Tokyo Station you will be greeted by a professional and informative guide who will be with you throughout the whole day. Tour the Zenkoji Temple - a non-denominational temple with over 1,400 years of history built before Buddhism came to Japan. Enjoy a local cuisine lunch on the shopping street outside of the temple. After lunch, explore the Jigokudani Monkey Park where the popular Nagano hot springs are located. Watch and get up close to snow monkeys as they relax by the hot springs. Make sure to have your camera ready, the cute snow monkeys give you a great photo opportunity!

strIntroduction: Experience life as a poised Japanese Samurai or nimble Ninja to unveil the traditional culture of Japan and get a first hand taste of those action movie moves! Impersonate a Samurai or Ninja and take part in a rescue mission Understand the spirit and moral principles behind 'tate-dou' (the art of sword fighting) Learn from experienced Japanese masters and dress up in traditional clothing Enjoy a 60 or 90 minute lesson with time to take photographs Impersonate a Samurai or Ninja and take part in a rescue mission Impersonate a Samurai or Ninja and take part in a rescue mission Understand the spirit and moral principles behind 'tate-dou' (the art of sword fighting) Understand the spirit and moral principles behind 'tate-dou' (the art of sword fighting) Learn from experienced Japanese masters and dress up in traditional clothing Learn from experienced Japanese masters and dress up in traditional clothing Enjoy a 60 or 90 minute lesson with time to take photographs Enjoy a 60 or 90 minute lesson with time to take photographs What We Love:   What We Love: You too can learn to become an ancient Samurai or Japanese Ninja! After a brief talk to learn the history and basics of "Tate" (sword fighting), it's over to you to try your hand at this complex art usually only taught to stage or film actors. Not only do you have to focus on correcting the moves, but your deportment, gestures, etiquette, attentiveness as well as possessing discipline of mind are equally important. Believe us, it's harder than it looks! If you're impressed by the swift movements and subtle agility of a ninja then why not try your had at throwing stars and practicing the special hand 'seals' said to bring ninjas their superhuman skills! You'll certainly feel the part dressed in traditional outfits as you act out a fight using all the moves you've just learnt. Not only will you discover traditional Japanese culture but we promise you'll feel like you've just taken part in an action movie too! Of course, they'll be plenty of time for taking photographs as well!

The shrine is one of Osaka's oldest, founded before Buddhism during the third century. The Chinese influenced most shrine designs in Japan; however, Sumiyoshi Grand Shrine is one of the country's few shrines considered purely Japanese. Grab another taste of the city with an authentic street food experience. Enjoy the local Osakan dish kushi-katsu - the perfect combination of pork, squid, octopus, lotus root, shishito pepper and eggplant!

strIntroduction: Encounter the ancient and ornate temples and expansive grassy park, home to the famed Nara nodding deer, on this day trip to Nara from Osaka Enjoy a convenient afternoon tour of Nara from Osaka Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine Shop for mementos at Nara Nagomikan, the largest souvenir shop in Nara Enjoy a convenient afternoon tour of Nara from Osaka Enjoy a convenient afternoon tour of Nara from Osaka Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine Shop for mementos at Nara Nagomikan, the largest souvenir shop in Nara Shop for mementos at Nara Nagomikan, the largest souvenir shop in Nara What We Love:   What We Love: Providing travelers with the perfect excursion from the big city, the beautiful city of Nara (once Japan's capital) is an ideal nature escape in all seasons. Famed for the thousands of deer that graze and roam freely in the park as well as the significant temples dating from the eighth century. Once inside the park you'll visit two UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Todai-ji Temple is an iconic symbol of the Nara Period and one of the world's largest wooden structures. The huge 15-meter bronze Great Buddha is truly a sight to behold. Kasuga Taisha Shrine, built in 768 AD, is famed for its stone and bronze lanterns. Making your way to the shrine, you'll encounter a number of deer, thought to be the shrine messengers. Eternally hungry, you can purchase food to feed the deer who will thank you with their characteristic nodding!

Travel back in time with a trip through Kyoto's famous historic sites on a day tour leaving from Osaka. Experience the traditional serenity of Kyoto's main shines—Kitano-tenmangu Shrine and Heian Jingu Shrine Explore the detailed architecture and grounds of the Kyoto Imperial Palace Stroll through an array of temples including Kinkaku-ji Temple, Sanjusangen-do Temple and Kiyomizu Temple Transport back to the 1600s with a visit to the Nijo Castle Enjoy a tasty lunch plus hotel pick up included in the tour Experience the traditional serenity of Kyoto's main shines—Kitano-tenmangu Shrine and Heian Jingu Shrine Experience the traditional serenity of Kyoto's main shines—Kitano-tenmangu Shrine and Heian Jingu Shrine Explore the detailed architecture and grounds of the Kyoto Imperial Palace Explore the detailed architecture and grounds of the Kyoto Imperial Palace Stroll through an array of temples including Kinkaku-ji Temple, Sanjusangen-do Temple and Kiyomizu Temple Stroll through an array of temples including Kinkaku-ji Temple, Sanjusangen-do Temple and Kiyomizu Temple Transport back to the 1600s with a visit to the Nijo Castle Transport back to the 1600s with a visit to the Nijo Castle Enjoy a tasty lunch plus hotel pick up included in the tour Enjoy a tasty lunch plus hotel pick up included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a historic journey through shrines, castles and temples. Few places in the world can offer such a trip—Kyoto happens to be one of them. With this Kyoto tour leaving from Osaka travelers are encouraged to leave their technology-filled lives and venture to Kyoto's serene Kitano-tenmangu Shrine and Heian Jingu Shrine. However, the journey doesn't end there. The trip fills the day with a visit to the elegant Nijo Castle and Kyoto Imperial Palace, and welcomes the afternoon with a succession of Temple visits. This Kyoto day trip is perfect for any Kyoto first-timers wanting to experience the traditional heart of Japan's cultural city.

Travel 150 meters up to the Floating Garden Observatory in the Umeda Sky Building, and marvel at the 360-degree panoramic view of Osaka's towering skyscrapers and booming city life. Gain a new perspective of the city with a riverboat cruise past Osaka's flourishing landscapes and historical sites. From sky, water and land, this one-day walking tour gives you an unparalleled view of one of Japan's most famous cities.

Take a dip in the oldest onsen in Japan and discover the area's unique golden and silver springs Discover the ancient streets of Kita-ku with a history spanning over 1400 years Take a dip in the Arima Onsen's largest springs at the Taikou-no-yu spa Travel conveniently to the onsen from Kobe just a short train ride away Choose the Arima Onsen Taikou-no-yu admission only ticket, or choose the extra skin treatment and sauna zone package for added luxury Discover the ancient streets of Kita-ku with a history spanning over 1400 years Discover the ancient streets of Kita-ku with a history spanning over 1400 years Take a dip in the Arima Onsen's largest springs at the Taikou-no-yu spa Take a dip in the Arima Onsen's largest springs at the Taikou-no-yu spa Travel conveniently to the onsen from Kobe just a short train ride away Travel conveniently to the onsen from Kobe just a short train ride away Choose the Arima Onsen Taikou-no-yu admission only ticket, or choose the extra skin treatment and sauna zone package for added luxury Choose the Arima Onsen Taikou-no-yu admission only ticket, or choose the extra skin treatment and sauna zone package for added luxury What We Love:   What We Love: At the base of a scenic valley, Arima Onsen, Japan's most famous hot spring town, lies deep in the north of the Rokko Mountain range behind Kobe city. It is the oldest onsen (hot spring) town in Japan, founded 1300 years ago. Since the days of old, it has been well known as a timeless spa resort where Emperors, court nobles, samurai, and other great minds visited. Furthermore, the town's classic Japanese architecture and its numerous historical temples, shrines, and houses have fortunately been well preserved and make a great place to stroll through some of Japan's oldest streets and to take a dip it some ancient hot springs at the fantastic Taikou-no-yu spa. With access from Kansai International Airport and Kyoto within two hours, Arima Onsen makes for a great day trip with convenient access to the nearby cities.

Enhance your afternoon with a trip to expertly crafted temples and a visit to the vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine on an easy day tour of Kyoto from Osaka Walk through the characteristically vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine Explore the world's longest wooden structure, Sanjusangen-do Temple Visit the Kiyomizu temple and walk through the historic shopping lane leading to its entrance Walk through the characteristically vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine Walk through the characteristically vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine Explore the world's longest wooden structure, Sanjusangen-do Temple Explore the world's longest wooden structure, Sanjusangen-do Temple Visit the Kiyomizu temple and walk through the historic shopping lane leading to its entrance Visit the Kiyomizu temple and walk through the historic shopping lane leading to its entrance What We Love:   What We Love: Transform your afternoon into an adventure filled with expertly crafted temples and a visit to the vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine. You won't want to pass up this opportunity to take an afternoon out of Osaka and turn it into a memorable journey through Kyoto's history.

In only a day experience the spiritual natural beauty of Miyajima and the historic significance of Hiroshima Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Ride the iconic Shinkansen (bullet train) in both directions Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Ride the iconic Shinkansen (bullet train) in both directions Ride the iconic Shinkansen (bullet train) in both directions What We Love:   What We Love: Enlighten your previous notions of WWII with a day trip that will put into perspective the impact of the first atomic bombing. The Atomic Bomb Dome is an important element of the trip, reminding us of the destruction the bomb caused. The Dome is now preserved to promote peace and the elimination of all atomic bombs. Don't worry, the somber atmosphere doesn't stay for long. Witness the spiritual beauty of the Itsukushima Shrine. Famed as a floating shrine on the sea, Itsukushima Shrine surrounds itself by the Prussian blue sea and the picturesque virgin forest. Anyone wanting a day of wondrous sightseeing and purposeful historic learning, then give this trip a shot!

Embark on a guided walk through the beautiful nature of Sandankyo Valley, visiting waterfalls and gliding through peaceful river gorges Take a break from city life and escape into the outstanding Hiroshima countryside Don't miss the gorgeous red hues of the maple tree season in October Learn more about the area from your experienced private guide Take a boat down the Shiwagi River and through Sandankyo gorge, regarded as one of Japan's most beautiful Witness some spectacular natural sights including five waterfalls, deep lagoons, huge boulders and glistening streams Take a break from city life and escape into the outstanding Hiroshima countryside Don't miss the gorgeous red hues of the maple tree season in October Learn more about the area from your experienced private guide Take a boat down the Shiwagi River and through Sandankyo gorge, regarded as one of Japan's most beautiful Witness some spectacular natural sights including five waterfalls, deep lagoons, huge boulders and glistening streams What We Love:   What We Love: Hiroshima might be most known for the symbol of peace it now represents after the tragic events of World War II, but did you know that Hiroshima is also blessed with a beautiful climate and outstanding nature? On this one day guided walking tour from Hiroshima, you'll visit the spectacular scenery of Sandankyo Valley, a designated area of natural beauty, boasting five cascading waterfalls, boating trips through canyons and an oasis of calm. You'll get a completely different experience in every season: cherry blossoms in Spring, lush green colours in Summer, red hues and maple leaves in Fall, and peaceful snowy scenery in Winter. Stroll through scenic forests, take in the fresh air and enjoy a tranquil boat ride through 13km Sandankyo Gorge. With Hiroshima hotel pick up and an informative English speaking guide to fill you in on the area's history, this tour makes for the perfect city escape.
strTitle: Sandankyo Valley Private Walking Tour (from Hiroshima)

What We Love:   What We Love: Embarking on a scenic railway journey in Japan is an experience like no other. Breeze past the incredible view of the Hozugawa Ravine on this 25 minute scenic railway journey on the Sagano Romantic Train. Departing from Kameoka Station, you'll travel the 7.3km to Sago Station along a beautiful mountainous route. In winter, you'll be surrounded by a snowy wonderland, in spring blooms wild cherry blossoms, summer brings luscious green panoramas and a cooling river breeze, whilst in autumn the whole landscape is cloaked in fall colors and lined with maple trees. Seats are limited and book up quickly - however, for a limited time, book on Klook for this November and you'll be guaranteed a seat to experience the glorious red hues of autumn!

Kappa cooking course What We Love:   What We Love: Ever wondered how Japanese chefs manage to pack so many interesting flavors into the tiny treats in a bento box? Come along to a traditional cooking class to learn the tricks of the trade from expert local chefs. The sessions provide a fun and interactive environment for learning about the preparation of sushi, sesame salads and many other specialities. Your teachers will also offer you an insight into the historical background of 'Bento', and you'll be able to dress in sumae (the traditional dress of a working buddhist monk) to complete your cultural experience. After you've spent the morning perfecting your cooking skills, you'll feast upon your mini creations as you get to know the fellow chefs on your course. It's a fun filled morning of cultural discovery - foodies, don't miss out!

Using Osaka's lively Umeda district as your base, offering gourmet dining and trendy shopping, explore Hankyu's train lines which snake their way into Kyoto and Kobe.

Tennoji, Shin-Osaka and Kyoto) on presenting your ICOCA card (temporary visitors with foreign passports only) What We Love:   What We Love: Visit any modern city these days and chances are there will be a local travel card making transportation, shopping and more even easier. It's the Octopus Card in Hong Kong, Easy Card in Taiwan, Suica Card in Tokyo, and for the Kansai region it's the ICOCA Card. A play on the phrase 'Iko ka' (行こか) meaning 'Shall we go?' in the local dialect, the card covers the major cities of the Kansai region including Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe. With one swipe of the contactless card, you can seamlessly hop aboard metros, buses, trains or even pay for your shopping. The card is handily preloaded with 1,500 yen credit, plus the 500 yen deposit so it's ready to use as soon as you pick it up.

Experience the narrow streets of Miyahawacho, the second biggest entertainment district in the city. Ride past the vibrant Yasaka Shrine and nod to geiko women and their maiko (apprentices) as they stroll through the stone laden streets of Gion adorned in delicate kimono. Cycling through these traditional districts offers an unmatchable perspective of Kyoto. Break away from cliché tours and feed your inner adventurer!

Tour Higashiyama's series of religious sites and ancient streets from the comfortable perch of your rickshaw and let your guide show you the true majesty of Kyoto's elite shrines and temples Tour on a traditional rickshaw to view the townhouses as you pass by on the traditional flagstone paths Explore impressive temples, such as the Kiyomizu or Ginkakuji temples, which are two of the most famous temples in Kyoto Enjoy a romantic rickshaw ride in the old Gion district, where you might catch a glimpse of a Geisha heading for an appointment Ask your friendly rickshaw guide for many tantalizing historical facts before dropping you off at a convenient location Tour on a traditional rickshaw to view the townhouses as you pass by on the traditional flagstone paths Explore impressive temples, such as the Kiyomizu or Ginkakuji temples, which are two of the most famous temples in Kyoto Enjoy a romantic rickshaw ride in the old Gion district, where you might catch a glimpse of a Geisha heading for an appointment Ask your friendly rickshaw guide for many tantalizing historical facts before dropping you off at a convenient location What We Love:   What We Love: Rest your legs and feet and let the vibes of Kyoto's best-preserved district, Higashiyama, wash over you while enjoying the sights of the historic streets and townhouses from the comfort of your rickshaw. If you get lucky, you might even catch a glimpse of a beautiful geisha in Gion! Riding through the narrow streets, along the wooden houses and traditional shops of old Kyoto, the rickshaw rides are a perfect way to tour the majesty of Higashiyama whilst also treating a loved one in style.

Keifuku Electric Railroad) which took it's first journey in 1910, now running for over 100 years! The tram not only takes you from Kyoto to Arashiyama but also serves Tenryuji, Ryoanji, Kinkakuji, Ninnaji and Kyoto Uzumasa Eigamura (Toei Movie Land) with numerous stops along the tram's two routes: the Arashiyama Line and the Kitano Line. If you've ever seen photos of a phenomenal green bamboo forest in Japan, you'll be looking at Arashiyama. An easy day trip from Kyoto, Arashiyama makes for a delightful nature escape. You'll discover numerous cultural sites such as temples and Japanese gardens at the other stops plus the movie set of Jidaigeki, a Japanese historical drama, at Toei Movie Land. Get unlimited travel on Randen trams plus optional Kyoto Subway or Kyoto Bus travel on one convenient Kyoto travel pass. With services every 10 minutes, Randen makes for an efficient and iconic way to discover in and around Kyoto.

strIntroduction: Sightsee Japan's ancient capitals in a day and see the most impressive cultural and historical sights of Kyoto and Nara Enjoy a convenient one-day tour of Kyoto and Nara See Kyoto's impressive landmarks Nijo Castle, Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto Imperial Palace (or Kitano Tenmangu Shrine) Relax mid-tour with a delicious Japanese-style lunch Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine and shop for souvenirs at Nara Nagomikan Enjoy hotel pick up and drop off plus comfortable coach transportation throughout Enjoy a convenient one-day tour of Kyoto and Nara Enjoy a convenient one-day tour of Kyoto and Nara See Kyoto's impressive landmarks Nijo Castle, Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto Imperial Palace (or Kitano Tenmangu Shrine) See Kyoto's impressive landmarks Nijo Castle, Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto Imperial Palace (or Kitano Tenmangu Shrine) Relax mid-tour with a delicious Japanese-style lunch Relax mid-tour with a delicious Japanese-style lunch Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine and shop for souvenirs at Nara Nagomikan Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine and shop for souvenirs at Nara Nagomikan Enjoy hotel pick up and drop off plus comfortable coach transportation throughout Enjoy hotel pick up and drop off plus comfortable coach transportation throughout What We Love:   What We Love: Explore world famous Kyoto in the morning, one of Japan's most important historical and cultural centers, known for its beauty and fascinating geisha tradition. Tour Kyoto's UNESCO-listed sites including Nijo Castle, built in 1626 to provide lodging for Tokugawa Shogun, and Kinkaku-ji Temple, or more aptly known as the Golden Pavilion for the thin layer of pure gold that covers it. Gain exclusive access to the Kyoto Imperial Palace and enjoy a delicious Japanese-style lunch. On arrival in Nara, you'll explore the beautiful green grounds and meet the famous nodding deer of Nara Park plus get the opportunity to enter the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of Todai-ji Temple (and the Great Buddha) and Kasuga Taisha Shrine. Comfortable coach transportation is provided, making this a stress-free way to sightsee two cities in a day!

Spend quality time with nature as you visit lush green gardens together with your guide or enjoy gliding through parts of the iconic Arashiyama bamboo forest leading to a popular shrine in its midst. Let the 'Zen' spirit bring your body to perfect harmony as you gaze upon the splendid temple architecture and tranquil forest, feeling like true nobility as you enjoy the services of an enthusiastic tour guide from your rickshaw seat.

Gaze upon the 200 different types of Kimono and choose one that best suits you. A professional stylist prepares your hair in a traditional up-do readying you to take on the streets of Gion adorned in your delicate attire. This experience offers a relaxing day to dress elegantly and receive a local's view of Gion's entertainment district.

Stroll along the oldest streets of Kyoto and learn about the lives of geishas Visit three Geisha districts in Kyoto - Gojyorakuen, Miyagawacho and Gion Learn about the process of becoming a Geisha and their daily lives Enter Kaikado, the shop with the longest history in producing handmade tea caddies and Kenninji, the oldest Zen temple which is known to be the birthplace of Japanese green tea Visit Tatsumi Inari Shrine, where girls pray to become accomplished geisha and famous names are etched into the structure Visit three Geisha districts in Kyoto - Gojyorakuen, Miyagawacho and Gion Learn about the process of becoming a Geisha and their daily lives Enter Kaikado, the shop with the longest history in producing handmade tea caddies and Kenninji, the oldest Zen temple which is known to be the birthplace of Japanese green tea Visit Tatsumi Inari Shrine, where girls pray to become accomplished geisha and famous names are etched into the structure What We Love:   What We Love: Take a walk down the three most famous geisha districts in Kyoto where you will pay a visit to establishments significant to the city's rich history. Stroll along the pathways of Gojyorakuen, once the most notorious red light district, before visiting Miyagawacho, known for geisha with talents for Japanese dance. The respectable geisha profession is often misrepresented - this tour aims to correct any misinformation. As you stroll the streets of Gion, your guide will explain all about what being a geisha means as you pass by boarding residences and entertainment houses. You may hear the faint tunes of geisha practising their musical skills or watch as a beautifully dressed geisha hurries over cobbled streets and ornate bridges to her next appointment. You'll also see the oldest Zen temple in Kyoto, also the birthplace of Japanese green tea, and a shrine with famous celebrities and geisha etched in the red posts.

Take a guided walk around Okochi Mountain Villa, Togetsukyo Bridge and other prominent locations in Arashiyama near Kyoto Visit Nonomiya Shrine, a popular place for single people to pray for marriage See Tenryuji Temple, one of Kyoto’s most beautiful Zen temples Enjoy a relaxing stroll through the extensive bamboo grove that stretches as far as the eye can see Learn more about the places from government licensed tour guides who are both friendly and dedicated to helping you Visit Nonomiya Shrine, a popular place for single people to pray for marriage See Tenryuji Temple, one of Kyoto’s most beautiful Zen temples Enjoy a relaxing stroll through the extensive bamboo grove that stretches as far as the eye can see Learn more about the places from government licensed tour guides who are both friendly and dedicated to helping you What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the western outskirts of Kyoto, Arashiyama is famed for its beautiful scenery and well-preserved ancient royal court. Enter the former villa of late actor Okochi Denjiro, the Okochi Sanso Villa – take a stroll through the traditional Japanese garden rumored to be built by Denjiro as a picture of everlasting beauty (not the deteriorating beauty captured on film). Explore one of Kyoto's great Zen temples, the Tenryuji Temple – built in 1339 by the shogun Ashikaga Takauji in honor of the late Emperor Godaigo, with a number of vantage points offering the best views of Arashiyama. Complete your journey at iconic Togetsukyo Bridge, the 'Moon Crossing Bridge', known for beautiful reflections in the Oi River.
strTitle: Arashiyama Bamboo Forest Half Day Tour

strIntroduction: In only a day experience the spiritual natural beauty of Miyajima and the historic significance of Hiroshima Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome What We Love:   What We Love: Enlighten your previous notions of WWII with a day trip that will put into perspective the impact of the first atomic bombing. The Atomic Bomb Dome is an important element of the trip, reminding us of the destruction the bomb caused. The Dome is now preserved to promote peace and the elimination of all atomic bombs. Don't worry, the somber atmosphere doesn't continue for long as you witness the spiritual beauty of the Itsukushima Shrine. Famed as a floating shrine on the sea, Itsukushima Shrine surrounds itself by the Prussian blue sea and the picturesque virgin forest. Anyone wanting a day of wondrous sightseeing and purposeful historic learning, then give this trip a shot!

Take a break from temple hopping to discover the diverse local food and retail culture of Kyoto Browse for foods, tea, cooking utensils and more at Nishiki Market's 130 shops! Witness the coexistence of traditional and modern retail culture on Teramachi Street Visit Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine, dedicated to academics and business Let your English speaking guide share fascinating facts about the area and pick out the best shops Browse for foods, tea, cooking utensils and more at Nishiki Market's 130 shops! Witness the coexistence of traditional and modern retail culture on Teramachi Street Visit Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine, dedicated to academics and business Let your English speaking guide share fascinating facts about the area and pick out the best shops What We Love:   What We Love: Start your morning amongst the bustle and hustle of Nishiki Market, a traditional Japanese market home to an assortment of food products and over a hundred shops selling fresh seafood, seasonal produce and cookware – it's no wonder it's known as 'Kyoto's kitchen'! Our recommendation? Try the soymilk of Senmaruya, a vital ingredient for Kyoto home cooking, with a history of over 210 years. You might find your visit to Teramachi Kyogoku Street somewhat bemusing: the confluence of historical and modern results in the big fashion brands like Louis Vuitton nestled comfortably beside the traditional shops like woodblock painting store Daishodo. This tour is the perfect fusion of cultural experience...and retail therapy session!
